node.title: Justin Bieber urged to cancel concert in Saudi Arabia in protest over human rights record
node.alt: A composite image of pop star Justin Bieber and Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman
node.description: Pop star Justin Bieber faces growing calls to cancel a concert in Saudi Arabia over the Kingdom's human rights record. The fiancee of slain Saudi critic Jamal Khashoggi joins a chorus of voices urging him not to perform.
node.content:
["Pop star Justin Bieber is facing growing calls to cancel a\u00a0concert in Saudi Arabia over the kingdom's\u00a0human rights record.", "The fiancee of slain Saudi critic Jamal Khashoggi,\u00a0Hatice Cengiz,\u00a0joined a chorus of voices urging him not to perform at the kingdom's Formula 1 event next month.", "Ms Cengiz urged Bieber to cancel his December 5 performance in the Red Sea city of Jiddah to \"send a powerful message to the world that your name and talent will not be used to restore the reputation of a regime that kills its critics\".", "Bieber's concert is one of the most high-profile\u00a0performances scheduled for the race, although other F1 concert performers include rapper A$AP Rocky, DJs David Guetta and Tiesto and singer Jason Derulo.", "It is not the first time a pop star has faced pressure to pull out of a concert in Saudi Arabia.", "Mariah Carey was the biggest-name performer to hit the stage in Saudi Arabia after Khashoggi was killed\u00a0by Saudi agents in Turkey in October 2018.", "She brushed off calls to boycott the show.", "However, public pressure prompted Nicki Minaj to cancel an appearance in 2019. She said she\u00a0wanted to show support for women's rights, gay rights and freedom of expression.", "Khashoggi's killing was carried out by members of a team of 15 Saudi government agents who were sent to Istanbul.", "The writer and former government spokesman had an appointment at the Saudi consulate for documents needed to marry Ms Cengiz.", "She waited for\u00a0him outside the consulate, but he never walked out. His body was never found.", "The killing by agents who worked for the Crown Prince drew international concern and cast a shadow over Prince Mohammed Bin Salman, whose reputation never fully recovered.", "Prince Mohammed has maintained he had no prior knowledge of the operation that killed Khashoggi.", "", "
The Rosberg X Racing car in the desert\u00a0driven by\u00a0Johan Kristoffersson and Molly Taylor,\u00a0 drives through the desert in the Saudi Arabia leg of the Extreme E series in Al-'Ula on Sunday April 5, 2021.(Supplied: Extreme E)
", "A US\u00a0intelligence assessment made public under US President Joe Biden, however, determined the Crown Prince approved the operation.", "\"Please know that your invitation to participate in a concert in Jiddah comes directly from MBS, as the Crown Prince is known,\" Ms Cengiz wrote in an\u00a0open letter to Bieber in The Washington Post.", "\"Nothing of significance happens in Saudi Arabia without his consent, and certainly not an event as important and flashy as this.\"", "
Kingdom invests\u00a0in Bieber's concert promoter
", "Bieber's concert in Saudi Arabia is set to take place shortly before he opens a world tour in February that was rescheduled from 2020 due to the pandemic.", "In the time since, Saudi Arabia's state-owned sovereign wealth fund \u2014 steered by Prince Mohammed \u2014 scooped up shares in Live Nation, the company that owns Ticketmaster and promotes concerts for Bieber and other major stars.", "As Live Nation's shares plummeted last year during COVID-19 lockdowns and the cancellation of thousands of shows, the Public Investment Fund bought $500 million worth of shares in the battered company.", "Public filings show the Saudi wealth fund is now the second-largest institutional holder in Live Nation, with a stake worth some $1.4 billion.", "Human Rights Watch has also called on Bieber and the other performers to pull out of the F1 concerts in Saudi Arabia, saying the\u00a0events are an example of \"sportwashing\", diverting attention and deflecting scrutiny from Saudi Arabia's human rights record.", "Saudi youth are the main attendees of these concerts, enjoying the country's newfound social changes that allow for music and gender mixing.", "The kingdom's General Sports Authority argues that sports is a tool for social change within the kingdom.", "Next month's F1 race will be the first time Saudi Arabia hosts the premier sporting event, though the kingdom has hosted the lesser-known Formula-E race in past years in an effort to raise the country's profile as a tourist destination.", "At the time of Khashoggi's killing, the Crown Prince was being lauded for ushering in social reforms transforming life for many inside the country.", "Khashoggi had been writing columns for The Washington Post criticising the Crown Prince's brash foreign policy moves and simultaneous crackdown on activists and perceived critics, including women's rights activists, writers, clerics and economists.", "Saudi Arabia held a trial for some of those involved in his killing, sentencing five to death before sparing them of execution.", "Khashoggi's fiancee said she would\u00a0keep speaking out in the hope\u00a0of giving a voice to those who remain imprisoned in Saudi Arabia for expressing their opinion.", "AP"]
